title: 2024 Running Goals
content:
## Goals for 2024

- Complete first 50K ultra (targeting Marin Ultra Challenge)
- Maintain 50+ miles/week base
- Hit sub-8:00 pace on long runs

### Equipment
- Primary shoes: Hoka Speedgoat 5 (size 10.5)
- Backup: Nike Pegasus Trail 4
- Hydration: Salomon soft flask

### Nutrition Plan
Plant-based diet, focus on:
- Pre-run: oats with banana and almond butter
- During: dates, gels
- Post-run: smoothie with Vega protein, banana, spinach

### Training Schedule
Run 5x per week, yoga on rest days, rock climbing Wednesday evenings.
Track everything on Strava. Morning runs since I'm an early bird (6am wake).

### Supplements
Taking vitamin D, B12, and creatine daily.

title: Home Setup Wishlist
content:
## Apartment Wishlist

Living in a 1BR apartment in San Francisco. Going for minimalist Japanese style.

### Current Setup
- Sonos speakers (living room + bedroom)
- Philips Hue lights (warm tones, 2700K evenings)
- Standing desk for remote work

### Wishlist
- Low-profile walnut platform bed (Japanese futon-style)
- Muji-style modular shelving
- Tatami mat area for meditation (daily Headspace practice)
- Cable management for desk setup
- Monitor arm for clean desk surface

### Budget
Mid-range spending, prefer quality over quantity.
Looking at Patagonia for outdoor textiles, Allbirds for indoor slippers.

title: Vegan Meal Rotation
content:
## Weekly Plant-Based Meal Rotation

Diet: fully plant-based/vegan

### Favorite Cuisines
Japanese, Thai, Mexican, Mediterranean

### Monday
- Breakfast: overnight oats with banana and almond butter
- Lunch: Mediterranean grain bowl with hummus
- Dinner: Miso ramen with tofu and mushrooms

### Tuesday
- Breakfast: smoothie with Vega protein, banana, spinach
- Lunch: Black bean tacos
- Dinner: Thai green curry with vegetables

### Wednesday
- Breakfast: avocado toast on sourdough
- Lunch: leftovers from Tuesday
- Dinner: out or DoorDash (cooking 3-4 times/week)

### Cooking Notes
- Batch cook rice and quinoa on Sundays
- Keep hummus and dal prepped in fridge
- Oat milk latte every morning (light roast coffee)

title: Tech Stack Notes
content:
## My Development Stack

### Daily Tools
- Editor: VS Code with TypeScript language server
- Language: TypeScript (3+ years)
- Framework: React 19
- Project management: Linear
- Communication: Slack (prefer async communication)
- Version control: GitHub
- Design: Figma (for design reviews)

### Preferred Patterns
- Async-first development
- Concise, direct code reviews
- Remote work style

### Keyboard Setup
- HHKB Professional Hybrid (minimalist Japanese aesthetic)
- Walnut wrist rest
- Dark grey desk mat

### Podcasts While Coding
- Lex Fridman
- Software Engineering Daily

title: Trip Planning: Japan 2024
content:
## Japan Trip - 10 Days

### Flights
- SFO to NRT on United (window seat, economy)
- Also considering Alaska Airlines
- Carry-on only if possible

### Tokyo (5 days)
- Muji flagship Ginza
- D&Department Shibuya
- 21_21 Design Sight museum
- Trail running: Kamakura trails (1hr from Tokyo)

### Kyoto (5 days)
- Fushimi Inari trail running at sunrise
- Philosopher's Path neighborhood (Airbnb)
- Shojin ryori (Buddhist vegetarian cuisine)

### Food (Plant-Based)
- T's TanTan (vegan ramen, Tokyo Station)
- Ain Soph Ripple (Shinjuku)
- Afuri (yuzu shio ramen)

### Accommodation
Prefer Airbnb. Looking in Shimokitazawa (Tokyo).

### Budget
Mid-range. Adventure-style travel.

title: Morning Routine
content:
## Morning Routine

### Wake Up: 6:00 AM (early bird)

1. **6:00** - Wake up, hydrate (water + lemon)
2. **6:10** - Headspace meditation (10 min daily)
3. **6:25** - Supplements: vitamin D, B12, creatine
4. **6:30** - Morning run (5x/week) or yoga
   - Track on Strava
   - Hoka Speedgoat for trail, Nike Pegasus for road
5. **7:30** - Smoothie: Vega protein, banana, spinach
6. **7:45** - Oat milk latte, light roast
7. **8:00** - Shower
8. **8:30** - Start work (VS Code + Slack open)

### Non-Run Days
- Rock climbing or yoga
- Extra meditation time

### Sleep: Target 10:00 PM
7-8 hours of sleep minimum.

title: Work Tools Comparison
content:
## Work Tools Comparison

### Editor
| Tool | Rating | Notes |
|------|--------|-------|
| VS Code | 5/5 | Daily driver, TypeScript support is best |
| Neovim | 4/5 | Use occasionally, fast for quick edits |
| Cursor | 3/5 | AI features nice but VS Code extensions better |

### Project Management
| Tool | Rating | Notes |
|------|--------|-------|
| Linear | 5/5 | Clean, fast, great for engineering teams |
| Jira | 2/5 | Bloated, avoid |
| GitHub Issues | 3/5 | Good for open source |

### Communication
- Slack: prefer async communication, concise and direct
- Figma comments: for design feedback

### Frameworks
- React 19: primary
- TypeScript: non-negotiable
- Tailwind: for styling

title: Wine Journal 2024
content:
## Wine Tasting Notes 2024

### Preferences
Primary: Pinot Noir, Burgundy, Barolo
Secondary: Champagne, Sancerre

### January - Domaine de la Romanee-Conti 2018
- Region: Burgundy, France
- Tasting: Cherry, earth, mushroom, long finish
- Rating: 98/100
- Paired with: Aged Comte cheese

### February - Giacomo Conterno Barolo 2016
- Region: Piedmont, Italy
- Tasting: Rose petal, tar, dried cherry
- Rating: 95/100
- Paired with: Osso buco in Le Creuset

### March - Kistler Pinot Noir 2020
- Region: Sonoma Coast
- Tasting: Red fruit, vanilla, silky tannins
- Rating: 92/100

### Wine Trip Plans
- Napa Valley: Domaine Carneros, Etude, Bouchaine
- Tuscany: partner trip (using Delta SkyMiles)

### Budget: Premium - willing to splurge on special bottles

title: Skincare Routine
content:
## Premium Skincare Routine

### Morning
1. Gentle cleanser
2. Vitamin C serum (SkinCeuticals CE Ferulic)
3. Hyaluronic acid
4. SPF 50 (Supergoop Unseen Sunscreen)

### Evening
1. Double cleanse: oil cleanser then gel
2. Retinol (0.5% strength, building up)
3. Peptide cream (Augustinus Bader The Rich Cream)
4. Eye cream

### Weekly
- Exfoliate 2x with enzyme mask
- Sheet mask 1x

### Monthly
- Alternating: microneedling or hydrafacial at spa

### Supplements (Supporting Skin Health)
- Collagen peptides daily
- Omega-3
- Vitamin C

### Budget: Premium - invest in quality
### Age: 45, focus on anti-aging and glow

title: Plant Care Schedule
content:
## Houseplant Care - 15+ Plants

### Living in studio apartment in Austin, TX

### Plant Inventory
| Plant | Location | Water | Light |
|-------|----------|-------|-------|
| Pothos (3) | Hanging planters | Weekly | Indirect |
| Snake plant (2) | Bookshelf | Every 2-3 weeks | Low |
| Fiddle leaf fig | Window | Weekly | Bright indirect |
| Monstera | Corner | Weekly | Bright indirect |
| Succulents (5) | Windowsill | Every 2 weeks | Direct |
| Spider plant | Hanging | Weekly | Indirect |
| Calathea | Shelf | 2x week | Indirect |

### Pet Safety (cat: Pixel)
- TOXIC to cats: pothos, snake plant -- keep in hanging planters!
- Safe: spider plant, calathea, succulents
- Cat grass planter for Pixel to nibble

### Notes
Austin heat = more frequent watering in summer.
Fertilize monthly spring through fall.
Wall-mounted planters to save floor space.

title: Austin Food Guide
content:
## Best Austin Food - Pescatarian Guide

### Diet: Pescatarian
### Allergy: Tree nuts (always ask!)

### Food Trucks (Favorites)
- Chi'Lantro: Korean-Tex-Mex fusion (skip nut toppings)
- Veracruz All Natural: migas tacos with shrimp
- Dee Dee Thai: nut-allergy friendly
- Taste of Ethiopia: lentil stew on East Riverside

### Restaurants
- Uchi: incredible Japanese (omakase!)
- Ramen Tatsu-Ya: best ramen in Austin
- Nixta Taqueria: handmade tortillas
- Lenoir: farm-to-table, hot weather menu

### Delivery Apps
- DoorDash (most food trucks available)
- Grubhub (for Chi'Lantro and Veracruz)

### Coffee
Cold brew, black. Favorite shops:
- Fleet Coffee on E 5th
- Houndstooth Coffee
- Merit Coffee

### Cuisines: Korean, Tex-Mex, Vietnamese, Ethiopian

title: Recipe Experiments
content:
## Cooking Experiments - Pescatarian

### Diet: Pescatarian
### Allergy: Tree nuts
### Cooking frequency: 2-3x per week, experimenting

### Successful Recipes
1. **Gochujang Salmon Bowl** - Korean inspired
   - Salmon, rice, pickled veg, gochujang glaze
   - Nut-free, 25 min

2. **Shrimp Pho** - Vietnamese
   - Homemade broth, rice noodles, shrimp
   - No nut sauces, 40 min

3. **Fish Tacos** - Tex-Mex
   - Mango salsa, cabbage slaw, chipotle crema
   - 15 min weeknight go-to

4. **Misir Wot** - Ethiopian
   - Red lentil stew, naturally nut-free
   - Batch cook and freeze

### Meal Prep
- Sunday: cook lentil stew, prep rice, pickle vegetables
- Reduces DoorDash/Grubhub orders

### Delivery when lazy: DoorDash, Grubhub

content:

title: Meal Prep Rotation
content:
## Family Meal Prep - Vegetarian

### Diet: Vegetarian (whole family)
### Allergy: Daughter has peanut allergy (school is nut-free)

### Weekend Batch Cooking (Sunday, 2 hours)
1. Big pot of dal (red lentil) -- freezes well
2. Mediterranean hummus + roasted vegetables
3. Veggie chili or mac and cheese base
4. Coconut curry paste (mild for kids, add heat for adults)
5. Paneer tikka marinade

### Weeknight Quick Meals (20 min or less)
- Pressure cooker dal: 20 min
- Paneer tikka in air fryer: 15 min
- Chana masala with canned chickpeas: 15 min
- Aloo gobi shortcut: parboil in microwave, sauté with spices

### School Lunch Ideas (Peanut-Free!)
- Cheese quesadillas with hidden veggie puree
- Pasta salad with cherry tomatoes and mozzarella
- Mini samosas (freeze ahead)
- Paratha rolls with paneer and veggies
- Rice with mild dal in thermos

### Grocery: Instacart delivery, HelloFresh for variety
### Cuisines: Indian, Mediterranean, American comfort, Thai
### Coffee: Chai latte every morning

title: Medical Reference Notes
content:
## Clinical Reference Notes

### Work Setup
- Pediatrician, in-office 4 days/week
- EHR: Epic (SmartPhrases for efficiency)
- Clinical references: UpToDate
- Professional network: Doximity
- Admin: Google Workspace

### Asthma Management Protocol
- NAEPP stepwise approach
- Written action plan for every patient (green/yellow/red zones)
- Follow-up every 3-6 months for well-controlled
- Teach inhaler technique at every visit
- Epic SmartPhrase for asthma action plan

### Parent Education Resources
- AAP free downloadable handouts (multilingual)
- Short video demos of inhaler technique (share via Doximity)
- QR codes on printed handouts
- Google Docs for collaborative care plans

### Continuing Education
- UpToDate during chart review time
- Podcasts during commute: The Pediatric Insider, Parenting Unplugged
- Annual conferences

title: Home Organization System
content:
## Home Organization - 4BR Colonial House

### Location: Boston, MA
### Style: Organized/functional

### Toy Management
- One-in-one-out rule
- Toy rotation: store half, swap monthly
- Color-coded bins per child
- Picture labels for 4-year-old

### Kids' Rooms (Shared)
- Bunk beds with under-bed storage
- Each child has own color-coded section
- Daily 5-minute tidy routine (Alexa timer game)

### Mr. Whiskers (Hamster) Station
- Dedicated drawer unit for supplies
- Food, bedding, cleaning supplies in one spot

### Entryway
- Hooks for 3 backpacks
- Shoe bins (one per kid)
- Mail sorter

### Smart Home
- Alexa: reminders, timers, family routines
- Nest thermostat: scheduled temperatures
- Arlo cameras: check rooms remotely

### Weekly Family Clean-Up
Alexa reminder Sunday 4pm. Make it a game!

title: Gift Ideas for Family
content:
## Gift Ideas

### For Kids (ages 4, 7, 10)
- Educational STEM toys, books
- 4yo: Magna-Tiles ($40-60), Play-Doh science lab
- 7yo: LEGO Education sets ($50-80), Nat Geo kits

- KiwiCo subscription ($25/month)

- Raspberry Pi projects together

### Shopping Style: Practical/value-oriented
Stores: Amazon, Costco, Target, Primary (kids)
Always check: peanut-free for daughter's gifts

title: School Lunch Ideas
content:
## School Lunch Rotation - Peanut Free

### Requirements
- Vegetarian
- Peanut-free (daughter's allergy, school is nut-free)
- Kid-friendly
- Easy to prep in morning

### Week 1
- Mon: Cheese quesadilla + fruit + yogurt
- Tue: Pasta salad + cherry tomatoes + mozzarella sticks
- Wed: Mini samosas (from freezer batch) + raita dip
- Thu: Paratha roll with paneer + cucumber sticks
- Fri: Pizza day at school

### Week 2
- Mon: Veggie wrap with hummus + carrot sticks
- Tue: Rice with mild dal (thermos) + naan
- Wed: Cheese and veggie pinwheels
- Thu: Indian besan pancakes + fruit
- Fri: Pizza day at school

### Snacks (Peanut-Free)
- Masala roasted chickpeas
- Mango lassi popsicles (homemade)
- Sunflower seed butter + apple slices
- Aloo tikki (potato patties, from freezer)

### Containers: Amazon Basics bento-style with dividers

title: Fitness Routine (Busy Mom)
content:
## Fitness for Busy Pediatrician Mom

### Goal: Energy for the kids!
### Wake up: 5:30 AM (early bird schedule)
### Frequency: 3-4x per week

### Weekly Schedule
- Mon & Wed: Morning walks (30 min before kids wake)
- Tue & Thu: Home HIIT workout (Apple Fitness+, 20 min)
- Sat: Swimming with kids at community pool
- Sun: Family walk or bike ride

### Apps
- Apple Fitness+ (primary)
- Calm app (meditation 3x/week)

### Supplements
- Multivitamin
- Iron
- Calcium
- Vitamin D

### Wellness
- Annual physical checkup
- Meditation 3x/week with Calm
- Sleep: early bird (5:30am wake), target 10pm bedtime

### Notes
Keep workouts short and effective.
Involve kids when possible (swimming, walks, bike rides).

title: Garden Planting Calendar
content:
## Portland Garden Planting Calendar

### Garden Setup
- Raised beds for vegetables
- Fruit trees: apple and pear
- Pollinator garden with native Oregon species
- Composting: three-bin system + vermicomposting

### Spring (March-May)
- March: Start tomato seeds indoors, direct sow peas, carrots, radishes
- March 17: Plant potatoes (PNW tradition)
- April: Transplant lettuce, plant herbs
- May: Transplant tomatoes after last frost

### Heirloom Tomato Varieties
- Stupice (Czech, early ripener)
- Black Krim (stunning dark)
- Sungold (cherry, incredibly sweet)
- Brandywine (classic, warmest spot)
- Green Zebra (tangy, reliable)

### Companion Planting
- Basil with tomatoes (flavor + pest control)
- Marigolds as borders (deters nematodes)
- Borage near tomatoes (attracts bees)

### Herbs (near kitchen door)
Basil, cilantro, dill, parsley, lemon verbena, Thai basil, lovage, shiso

### Pollinator Garden
Bee balm, lavender, Oregon grape, red flowering currant, camas lily

title: Reading Log 2024
content:
## Reading Log - 2-3 Books Per Week

### Genres: Historical fiction, nature writing, biography, woodworking

### January
1. "The Pillars of the Earth" - Ken Follett (re-read, loved it)
2. "Braiding Sweetgrass" - Robin Wall Kimmerer (nature + indigenous wisdom)
3. "The Overstory" - Richard Powers (nature + narrative fiction)
4. "Wolf Hall" - Hilary Mantel (Tudor England)

### February
5. "H is for Hawk" - Helen Macdonald (grief + falconry)
6. "The Hidden Life of Trees" - Peter Wohlleben
7. "All the Light We Cannot See" - Anthony Doerr (WWII)
8. "Shantaram" - Gregory David Roberts

### March
9. "Pilgrim at Tinker Creek" - Annie Dillard
10. "The Name of the Rose" - Umberto Eco

### Library Book Club
Started "Braiding Sweetgrass" as first selection.
Volunteer at library. Fresh Air interview with Kimmerer was excellent.

### Podcasts
- Fresh Air (book recommendations)
- The Moth (storytelling)
- Woodworking Masterclass

title: Bird Sighting Journal
content:
## Backyard Bird Journal - Portland, OR

### Setup
- Multiple feeders at different heights
- Platform feeder: sunflower seeds
- Suet feeder: for woodpeckers
- Nyjer feeder: for goldfinches
- Hummingbird feeder: 4:1 water/sugar (no red dye)
- Pollinator garden attracts birds too

### Year-Round Residents
- Black-capped Chickadee (daily visitor)
- Dark-eyed Junco
- Spotted Towhee
- Anna's Hummingbird
- Downy Woodpecker (suet feeder)

### Seasonal Visitors
- Varied Thrush (winter - stunning orange/black)
- Cedar Waxwings (spring/summer)
- Western Tanagers (summer - bright yellow/red)
- American Goldfinch (spring - nyjer feeder)

### Indoor Cats: Hemingway and Fitzgerald
Kept indoors -- cats are #1 threat to songbirds!

### Notes
Keep journal of species, time, weather, behavior.
Sunflowers attract both pollinators and seed-eating birds.
Oregon is a birding paradise.

title: Sourdough Recipe Collection
content:
## Sourdough Recipes

### Starter: 3 years old, King Arthur bread flour
### Baking: Almost daily
### Diet: Omnivore, farm-to-table preference

### Classic Country Loaf
- 80% hydration
- 5-6 hour bulk fermentation at room temp
- Cold retard overnight in fridge
- Bake in Dutch oven at 500F -> 450F
- Score confidently with sharp lame

### Troubleshooting Notes
- Dense loaves = likely overproofing in warm weather
- Use poke test and windowpane test
- Portland room temp (60-68F) usually fine
- Summer: reduce bulk time or cold ferment

### Other Recipes
- Sourdough pizza dough (Friday night tradition)
- Sourdough pancakes (weekend breakfast)
- Sourdough crackers (with garden herbs)
- Sourdough focaccia (rosemary from garden)

### Pairings
- Fresh bread + garden heirloom tomatoes + basil + olive oil
- Bread with homemade jam (from fruit trees)

### Coffee: Black drip coffee, dark roast, local Portland roaster

title: Workshop Tool Inventory
content:
## Workshop Tool Inventory

### Location: Attached to craftsman house, Portland

### Hand Tools
- Chisels: Rockler premium set (1/4" to 1-1/2")
- Dovetail saw: Veritas
- Marking gauge: Tite-Mark
- Hand planes: #4 smoother, #5 jack, block plane
- Carving tools: palm gouges set

### Power Tools
- Table saw: SawStop (safety first)
- Bandsaw: 14" Rikon
- Drill press: floor-standing
- Random orbit sander
- Router table

### Organization
- French cleat wall system (made myself)
- Dedicated hand tool wall
- Mobile bases on power tools
- Lumber rack (vertical)
- Dust collection: two-stage with Thien baffle

### Brands: Rockler Woodworking, Veritas, Lie-Nielsen
### Shopping: Duluth Trading (work clothes), L.L. Bean, Carhartt

### Dust Control
- Ceiling-mounted air cleaner
- Blast gates at each tool
- Floor sweep near workbench
- Box fan air filter (DIY, furnace filters)

title: Travel Plans (Road Trips)
content:
## Road Trip & Travel Plans

### Travel Style: Road trips and national parks
### Frequency: 3-4 trips per year
### Fly: Alaska Airlines when needed (aisle seat, economy)
### Stay: State park cabins, B&Bs, KOA campgrounds

### Trip 1: Oregon Coast (Spring)
- Drive from Portland to Cannon Beach
- Haystack Rock birding
- Stay at state park cabin
- Explore tide pools

### Trip 2: Olympic National Park (Summer)
- Drive up from Portland
- Hoh Rainforest (nature writing inspiration)
- Ruby Beach
- Hurricane Ridge

### Trip 3: Bend, OR (Fall)
- Deschutes River trail cycling
- Craft beer scene (research for Portland comparisons)
- Smith Rock for hiking

### Trip 4: Glacier National Park (Summer)
- Going-to-the-Sun Road
- Extended birding opportunities
- B&B near West Glacier

### Dream Trips
- Maine coast
- Nova Scotia
- Acadia National Park

title: Home Maintenance Schedule
content:
## Craftsman House Maintenance

### Home: Craftsman house with workshop, Portland, OR
### Style: Arts and crafts

### Monthly
- HVAC filter (basic WiFi thermostat)
- Gutter check (Oregon rain!)
- Workshop dust collection filter clean

### Quarterly
- Exterior paint touch-up (craftsman details)
- Workshop tool maintenance (sharpen chisels, tune planes)
- Fruit tree care (prune, fertilize)
- Deep clean workshop

### Annual
- Roof inspection (before rainy season)
- Chimney sweep
- Garden soil test
- Workshop electrical check

### Pets: Hemingway and Fitzgerald (two cats)
- Monthly flea prevention
- Annual vet visits
- Litter management

### Garden Specific
- Raised beds: amend soil spring and fall
- Pollinator garden: divide perennials
- Compost: maintain three-bin system + worm bin
- Fruit trees: winter pruning (February)

### Tools for Home
L.L. Bean, Carhartt (work clothes), Duluth Trading
Basic WiFi thermostat (only smart device)
